reviewText: Most of season 3 Lorette was sick in bed and had guest hosts who always ended with "Good night, Loretta"These gems starred Irene Dunne, Rosalind Russell, Barbara Stanwick, Van Johnson, Ricardo Montalban, Joan Fontain, Claudette Colbert, and a few others.I would really like to see these, too.  It's kind of funny, but none of these guest hosts were allowed to come in through her "special Door."
summary: where are all the guest hosts?
Title: N/A

reviewText: Here's the third volume in Timeless Media Group's series of LORETTA YOUNG SHOW releases.  The 31 episodes collected here are from the third and fourth seasons (circa. 1955-57), and most star Loretta herself.  As with the prior volumes, all of the episodes have been drawn from the Loretta Young Estate and are the original broadcast length.  For it's eventual syndication, the show was re-cut into THE LORETTA YOUNG THEATRE (omitting Young's famous entrances and portions of her opening speeches) but rest assured that all episodes here seem complete and uncut, just like they originally aired on NBC.The sheer prestigious nature of this series cannot be underestimated - it remains nothing less than a milestone, and a testament to the talent and stamina of Loretta Young.  Each week Ms Young dazzled audiences in stories of drama, comedy, historical intrigue and bittersweet romance.  A lesser actress would never have made this series click so magnificently.In this set there are two more delightful installments of "Inga"; one of Ms Young's most popular characters.  Inga runs a detention camp for prisoners; a warm-hearted Swedish woman who sees people for what they are on the inside, regardless of their past wrongs.  Another LORETTA YOUNG SHOW mainstay was Sister Ann, and she returns for another story in this collection as well.  You'll also witness Young's transformation into "Queen Nefertiti" (one of the most lavish episodes in the history of the show).  "The Pearl" casts Young as the devoted wife of a poor Japanese fisherman; and in "Gesundheit", Young is a Broadway actress who's allergic to her leading man!I won't spoil all the surprises.  THE LORETTA YOUNG SHOW is a slice of classic television at it's glamorous best.  I hope to review more volumes soon.Includes:* Christmas Stopover* Inga #3* Inga #4* The Secret* The Pearl* Gesundheit* His Inheritance* But for God's Grace* Double Partners* The Question* Little League* Now a Brief Word* The Years Between* Goodbye, Goodbye* The Great Divide* The End of the Week* Somebody Else's Dream* Three and Two, Please* Imperfect Balance* Queen Nefertiti* My Favourite Monster* Miss Ashley's Demon* Tension* Wedding Day* The Room Next Door* So Bright a Light* The Legacy* The Countess* Mind of Their Own* Royal Partners (double episode)

reviewText: These episodes are from Season 3 and 4. As always an anthology Loreatta Young plays different characters every episode.  True family entertainment with great acting and writing.
summary: The Loretta Young Show Is Wonderful !
Title: N/A

reviewText: I bought this specifically for the episode Christmas Stopover as I remember watching it on Familyland TV. Unfortunately the Loretta Young episodes are no longer shown on FL so I decided to purchase this 31 episode set. Wish I hadn't and wish FL still had it, it was enjoyable there.The episodes audio and video quality are simply terrible. I realize they are more than 50 years old, but the company has a visual introduction stating they have been remastered and there may be a "few" discrepancies due to age. When I saw this disclaimer about it being remastered I was rather pleased. Then I put a disc on.Every episode is bad -- scratchy video and the audio is even worse. I had the volume up to the max and still could not understand the dialogue. I played all the discs and they are all like that. Just awful!Where in the world is the remastering? Don't think so. The audio is very garbled and difficult to understand. The video is just disgraceful.The other point is the packaging,  YIKES!!  I couldn't get the four discs out of the box they were packed so tightly together. Even though each disc was in its own protective case, I had to unflap the top of the box and try pushing them out, broke two fingernails. I have left them out of the box - but would have liked to have kept it so as to keep them together in one box - but the packaging is so cheap it tore as I was trying to get them out.  Wish I could get my money back.I have a wonderful 50's Christmas set called Holiday TV Classics (see my review here on amazon for that) which is 100 times better than this set. It is now $4.50 I think. I bought it when it was $20.00 - I urge anyone interested in Christmas TV classics - 50's and 60's - to purchase this from amazon as it is great - no problems with audio or video - despite what you may read from other reviewers - 4 discs with tons of shows - and a virtual fireplace link too!  It is well worth the $4.50!!I would return this Loretta Young set but amazon doesn't accept returns once they've been opened --- Hey amazon how do we know we've gotten a lemon like this unless we open it? --- anyway this Loretta Young set was a BIG disappointment.  A disgrace to Loretta's life-long career and hard work and a big thumbs down to her estate for allowing this awful product to be issued.  Shame.
summary: Packaging stinks -Video and audio quality just awful!!!

reviewerName: Ready Steady Freddie "I'm Telling You Now"
reviewText: I like 50's shows like State Trooper, Coronado 9, M Squad,One Step Beyond etc. but this miserable show is so bad....it's on par with Medic, the show with the guy who went on to star in Have Gun will Travel....one cool thing was seeing Eddie Haskell in one of Loretta's show, but it was still boring...how this loser show lasted four seasons is beyond me....no really cool guest stars, just Loretta trying to act so sweet and demure.....and the DVD clowns who put this series out, must have thought they hit the goldmine cause they keep a Logo on during the whole shows, as if some idiot might try and bootleg this travesty....i think if they showed this at guantanamo bay to all the prisoners, they would get more information out of them then waterboarding....in fact I'll bet Dick (Feel My heartbeat) Chaney loves this show.....
summary: this is a hideously boring show, if you go for this buy Medic from the same period

reviewText: I am really enjoying these episodes.  Some could be in better shape, but I am so happy to receive these epidsodes, especially since Loretta Young is actually staring in them herself.  My favorites were always the ones she was actually in. The shows she had on were always worth watching though.  I especially was glad to receive another spisode with "Inga".  That show reminded me alot of "The Farmers Daughter"  which can't be beat.  I also have Season 1 and 2.Hopefully the rest of the seasons eventually are put out in dvd as I would like to have all 10 seasons, eventually.
